title: Senior HR Compliance Analyst
content:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.We are thrilled to expand our HR Compliance function (HRC) within Snowflake's HR Global Operations team. The Senior HR Compliance Analyst will play a crucial role in maintaining company-wide HR compliance, ensuring Snowflake's adherence to federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, specifically focusing on the assigned compliance areas within the HRC team.
You will work with a small but mighty team as you contribute to the growing scope of the HRC function.
AS AN HR COMPLIANCE ANALYST AT SNOWFLAKE, YOU WILL:

Act as the main contact point for all HR compliance service tickets, emails, and project inquiries.
Partner with Legal and HR professionals to draft, implement, and monitor HR policies and programs in accordance with applicable global laws and regulations (FLSA, EEOC, GDPR, etc.). 
Gather, audit, and deliver EEO and other HR data to meet government reporting requirements (EEO-1, CA Pay Data Report, VETS-4212, pay equity reports, etc.).
Responsible for overseeing the review, tracking, and communication of annual and mid-year AAP (Affirmative Action Plan) plans to stakeholders, as well as coordinating the development of new AAP Plans for emerging locations as required.
Act as the HR department's primary liaison between Control Owners and Auditors for HR SOX controls, overseeing control maintenance, compliance, and remediation efforts. You will ensure SOX objectives, deliverables, and timelines are met, and will be responsible for the coordination of testing controls by overseeing the evidence gathering, tracking status, gaps, and remediation actions.  
Address customer and prospective customer queries regarding HR Compliance and HR Operations. Collaborate with internal teams to collect necessary documentation and ensure accurate responses to MSA (Master Service Agreements) and RFP (Request for Proposal) questionnaires.
Assist with administering the workplace harassment prevention training for all new employees, provide technical support with the HR compliance training LMS, and support the vendor management process related to the LMS vendor. 
Coordinate with HR teams, as needed, to ensure timely submissions of state and federal reports and Bureau of Labor Statistics and OEWS filings.

OUR IDEAL HR COMPLIANCE ANALYST WILL HAVE:

Experience in HR compliance within large, global HR compliance projects for a multinational corporation, including expertise in areas such as GDPR, M&A, and pay equity audits.
Responsible for ensuring compliance with OFCCP and DFEH regulations. Familiarity with terms like OFCCP, DFEH, VEVRAA, and AAP is expected. You have experience filing EEO-1, PDR, and VETS-4212 reports and a strong grasp of the continuous nature of regulatory requirements.
Proficient in designing and implementing scalable compliance-related processes and programs.
Demonstrates the capacity to work independently, proactively identify solutions, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
Exhibits exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, effectively collaborating with employees across all organizational levels.

The ability to be in office full-time is a requirement for this role.

questions.description: When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Snowflake. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Snowflake’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Snowflake, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Snowflake will share your personal data with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Snowflake to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Snowflake’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site and such transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses as approved by the European Union Commission and/or the Privacy Shield framework. Further information about how Snowflake processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Notice (the term “privacy notice” to be a link to our privacy notice located at https://www.snowflake.com/privacy-policy/ ). Your personal data will be retained by Snowflake as long as we determine it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. You have the right to data portability, to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. Such requests can be made by contacting us at privacy@snowflake.com.
